item.title: 俄罗斯历史性安达曼演习几天后，中国和巴基斯坦海军举行演习
item.description:
The Chinese and Pakistani navies are holding weeklong drills in the Arabian Sea days after the Russian Pacific Fleet and Myanmar practised repelling attacks in their first maritime exercise, while India and the United States pledged security cooperation.翻译:俄罗斯太平洋舰队和缅甸在首次海上演习中进行击退攻击几天后，中国和巴基斯坦海军在阿拉伯海举行了为期一周的演习，而印度和美国则承诺进行安全合作。

At a naval base in Karachi on Saturday, the Chinese and Pakistani navies kicked off the exercise in the waters and airspace of the northern Arabian Sea in drills that include anti-submarine operations. The exercise will end on Nov. 17.翻译:周六，中国和巴基斯坦海军在卡拉奇的一个海军基地拉开了阿拉伯海北部海域和空域演习的序幕，演习内容包括反潜行动。演习将于11月17日结束。

During the exercise, China and Pakistan will conduct joint maritime patrols for the first time, the People's Liberation Army Daily reported on Monday.翻译:据《解放军报》周一报道，演习期间，中国和巴基斯坦将首次进行海上联合巡逻。

The exercise follows what Moscow describes as "the first Russian-Myanmar naval exercise in modern history" held from Nov. 7-9 in the Andaman Sea on the northeastern fringe of the Indian Ocean, a milestone for Russia's naval presence in a sea that the United States counts as one of its global security interests.翻译:此次演习是莫斯科所称的“现代史上首次俄缅海军演习”，该演习于11月7日至9日在印度洋东北部边缘的安达曼海举行，这是俄罗斯海军在印度洋海域存在的一个里程碑。美国被视为其全球安全利益之一。

Admiral Tributs and Admiral Panteleyev, two large Russian anti-submarine ships, conducted exercises with a frigate and a corvette of Myanmar's navy, according to Interfax news agency last week.翻译:据国际文传电讯社上周报道，俄罗斯两艘大型反潜舰“特里布茨海军上将号”和“潘捷列耶夫海军上将号”与缅甸海军的一艘护卫舰和一艘护卫舰进行了演习。

Amid the push for deeper security ties between China and Pakistan, and Russia and Myanmar, U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin held defence talks in New Delhi on Nov. 10 with their Indian counterparts.翻译:为推动中国与巴基斯坦、俄罗斯与缅甸深化安全关系，美国国务卿布林肯和国防部长劳埃德·奥斯汀于11月10日在新德里与印度外长举行防务会谈。

In a joint statement released after the so-called "2+2 Dialogue", the U.S. and Indian governments expressed deep concern over the war in Ukraine but made no explicit mention of Russia. They also pledged their commitment to safeguarding a free and open Indo-Pacific.翻译:在所谓“2+2对话”后发表的联合声明中，美国和印度政府对乌克兰战争表示深切关注，但没有明确提及俄罗斯。他们还承诺致力于维护自由开放的印太地区。

New Delhi has carefully preserved its longstanding relations with Russia, including cooperation in defence, even as its ties with Washington have grown steadily stronger.翻译:新德里小心翼翼地维护了与俄罗斯的长期关系，包括防务合作，尽管它与华盛顿的关系稳步加强。

China was also not mentioned in the joint statement, even though an Indian government official said ahead of the talks that China would be one of the "key focus points".翻译:尽管印度政府官员在会谈前表示中国将成为“ 关键焦点”之一，但联合声明中也没有提及中国。

The careful navigation of those talks comes ahead of a highly anticipated meeting between U.S. President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping in San Francisco this week, where Washington is expected to seek a re-establishment of military-to-military ties with Beijing.翻译:这些谈判是在美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平本周在旧金山举行备受期待的会晤之前进行的，预计华盛顿将寻求与北京重建军事关系。

Reporting by Ryan Woo; additional reporting by Lidia Kelly in Melbourne. Editing by Gerry Doyle翻译:瑞恩·吴 (Ryan Woo) 报道；莉迪亚·凯利在墨尔本的补充报道。格里·多伊尔编辑

item.title: 中国高科技制造业贷款引发廉价出口浪潮担忧
item.description:
China's leaders, determined to upgrade manufacturing, are steering money toward makers of high-tech products, from semiconductors to EVs, raising fears that overcapacity will fuel a new wave of cheap exports.翻译:中国领导人决心升级制造业，正在将资金转向从半导体到电动汽车等高科技产品制造商，这引发了人们对产能过剩将助长新一轮廉价出口浪潮的担忧。

Lending data from China's central bank offers a glimpse of government priorities: as of the end of September, outstanding loans to the troubled property sector fell 0.2% year-on-year but lending to the manufacturing sector jumped 38.2%.翻译:中国央行的贷款数据让我们一睹政府的优先事项：截至9月底，陷入困境的房地产行业的未偿还贷款同比下降0.2%，但制造业的贷款增长了38.2%。

Economists caution that this wave of investment differs in key respects from an earlier capital investment surge that, among other effects, inflated China's solar panel industry, triggered a trade fight and put scores of companies out of business.翻译:经济学家警告说，这波投资浪潮在关键方面与之前的资本投资激增有所不同，后者的影响之一是使中国太阳能电池板行业膨胀，引发贸易战并使数十家公司破产。

But the trend has alarmed some key trading partners, particularly in Europe where an investigation into Chinese EV subsidies is underway.翻译:但这一趋势引起了一些主要贸易伙伴的警惕，特别是在欧洲，那里正在对中国电动汽车补贴进行调查。

"There is lower consumption in China right now but you have massive overcapacity that is being pushed out to the world, including in batteries, solar and chemicals," said Jens Eskelund, president of the European Chamber of Commerce in Beijing.翻译:北京欧盟商会会长延斯·埃斯克伦德表示：“目前中国的消费量有所下降，但大量产能过剩正在被推向世界各地，包括电池、太阳能和化学品领域。”

"Europe and China are like two trains that are going to collide," Eskelund said, referring to trade.翻译:“欧洲和中国就像两列即将相撞的火车，”埃斯凯伦德在谈到贸易时表示。

China's industrial policy will be on the agenda at this week's meeting of the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum in San Francisco, where Chinese President Xi Jinping is expected to meet U.S. President Joe Biden.翻译:中国的产业政策将成为本周在旧金山举行的亚太经合组织（APEC）论坛会议的议程，预计中国国家主席习近平将在会上会见美国总统乔·拜登。

Under Xi, China has sought to make itself an advanced manufacturing powerhouse for high-end goods for the world, including EVs, wind turbines, aerospace components and advanced semiconductors. Critics say the push has come at the expense of another need - to get China to consume more and export less, a structural shift many economists see as key to preserving high levels of growth.

ADVANCED SECTORS

Policymakers have struggled with overcapacity before. Stimulus following the 2007-2008 global financial crisis triggered a boom in steel, solar and other areas, but also generated growth that ultimately helped absorb much of that new production, said Frederic Neumann, chief Asia economist at HSBC.翻译:政策制定者此前一直在与产能过剩作斗争。汇丰银行首席亚洲经济学家 Frederic Neumann 表示，2007-2008 年全球金融危机后的刺激措施引发了钢铁、太阳能和其他领域的繁荣，但也带来了增长，最终帮助吸收了大部分新产量。

This time, the government's focus is narrower, targeting high-tech and "advanced manufacturing", a goal laid out in 2021 in the 14th five-year plan.翻译:这一次，政府的关注重点更窄，瞄准了高科技和“先进制造业”，这是“十四五”规划中2021年制定的目标。

"China has adopted a strategy to shift investment spending from the real estate sector into manufacturing, which will drive up capacity further. Rather than boosting goods absorption via surging construction, China is opting to drive up the capacity of goods-producing industries," said Neumann.翻译:“中国采取了将投资支出从房地产行业转向制造业的战略，这将进一步提高产能。中国没有通过激增的建设来促进商品吸收，而是选择提高商品生产行业的产能，”他表示。诺依曼。

"Global markets, unfortunately, are not in a position to absorb the additional capacity."翻译:“不幸的是，全球市场无法吸收额外的产能。”

Another difference from previous episodes of overcapacity: the sums are smaller.翻译:与以往产能过剩时期的另一个不同之处是：总额较小。

The headline growth rate for financing into manufacturing is likely close to 18%, said Tao Wang, chief China economist at UBS, because the other major source of financing for companies - bonds - is down sharply, meaning a more modest combined increase.翻译:瑞银首席中国经济学家王涛表示，制造业融资的总体增长率可能接近18%，因为企业的另一个主要融资来源——债券——大幅下降，这意味着综合增长将更为温和。

And overall investment growth in Chinese manufacturing has been slowing as producers respond to a weak market.翻译:由于生产商应对疲软的市场，中国制造业的整体投资增长一直在放缓。

"Orders and profits are down and they tend to react to that," said Wang.翻译:“订单和利润下降，他们往往会对此做出反应，”王说。

Still, investment in high-tech manufacturing outpaces the rest of the sector. It grew 11.3% in the first nine months of 2023 year-on-year, compared with 6.3% for overall manufacturing investment, according to data from China's National Bureau of Statistics.翻译:尽管如此，对高科技制造业的投资仍然超过了该行业的其他领域。中国国家统计局的数据显示，2023 年前 9 个月，制造业投资同比增长 11.3%，而整体制造业投资增长 6.3%。

A Reuters review of more than 100 publicly available policy documents and state media reports found that dozens of provincial and municipal governments are increasing the proportion of government loans directed to green development, advanced manufacturing and strategic industries.翻译:路透社对100多份公开政策文件和官方媒体报道的审查发现，数十个省市政府正在提高针对绿色发展、先进制造业和战略性产业的政府贷款比例。

For example, Guangdong province has increased lending to both high-tech and advanced manufacturing by about 45%, state media reported. During the first half of 2023, outstanding loans to the high-tech manufacturing sector in the eastern province of Shandong jumped 67%.翻译:例如，据官方媒体报道，广东省已将高科技和先进制造业的贷款增加了约 45%。 2023年上半年，东部省份山东省高科技制造业的贷款余额猛增67%。

By the end of September, Dongguan, a southern manufacturing city of 7.5 million people, had a total outstanding loan balance to high-tech companies of 246 billion yuan ($33.7 billion), about a fifth of its economy.

OVERCAPACITY

Signs of excess capacity are appearing.翻译:产能过剩的迹象正在显现。

Forecasts indicate China will soon be able to meet all global demand for lithium-ion batteries, said Duo Fu, vice president of Rystad Energy.翻译:Rystad Energy副总裁多夫表示，预测表明中国很快就能满足全球对锂离子电池的所有需求。

Similarly, its automakers, including EV producers, had the capacity to produce 43 million cars a year at the end of 2022, with plants operating at just 54.5% capacity, China Passenger Car Association (CPCA) data show.翻译:同样，中国乘用车协会 (CPCA) 的数据显示，到 2022 年底，包括电动汽车生产商在内的中国汽车制造商的年产量为 4300 万辆，但工厂开工率仅为 54.5%。

Unfortunately, sluggish economic growth and stunted consumption limits what can be purchased domestically.翻译:不幸的是，经济增长乏力和消费低迷限制了国内购买。

After decades of prioritising supply, household consumption accounted for only 38% of gross domestic product in 2021 - even before the harshest COVID-19 lockdowns - compared with 68% for the U.S. and 55% the world average, World Bank data showed.翻译:世界银行的数据显示，经过几十年的优先供应，到 2021 年，即使在最严厉的 COVID-19 封锁之前，家庭消费仅占国内生产总值 (GDP) 的 38%，而美国的这一比例为 68%，世界平均水平为 55%。

In some ways, the race to invest in advanced sectors is helpful for China, said Lu Zhengwei, chief economist at Industrial Bank in Shanghai.翻译:上海兴业银行首席经济学家陆正伟表示，从某些方面来说，投资先进行业的竞赛对中国是有帮助的。

"Generally speaking, I think the investment in the new sectors is healthy and will support the sectors’ long-term development. They are investing while seeing overcapacity, which drives technological development."翻译:“总的来说，我认为对新行业的投资是健康的，将支持这些行业的长期发展。他们在看到产能过剩的情况下进行投资，这推动了技术发展。”

For the global economy, Chinese production could help curb inflation.翻译:对于全球经济而言，中国的生产可能有助于抑制通胀。

"Far from losing global export market shares, Chinese produces may gain competitiveness," said Neumann. "In turn, this could raise disinflationary pressures in global goods markets, helping to curtail inflation."翻译:“中国产品非但不会失去全球出口市场份额，反而可能会获得竞争力，”诺伊曼说。 “反过来，这可能会增加全球商品市场的通货紧缩压力，有助于抑制通胀。”

Neither point will mitigate trade tensions, particularly as many countries push plans to favour domestic high-tech industries.翻译:这两点都不会缓解贸易紧张局势，特别是在许多国家推行有利于国内高科技产业的计划的情况下。

"Over the long term, we need to have an adjustment process," said a Chinese government trade adviser, speaking on condition of anonymity. "We should let market forces eliminate some firms."翻译:“从长远来看，我们需要一个调整过程，”一位不愿透露姓名的中国政府贸易顾问表示。 “我们应该让市场力量淘汰一些企业。”

($1 = 7.2921 Chinese yuan renminbi)翻译:（1 美元 = 7.2921 人民币）

item.title: 中国双十一落下帷幕，电商巨头报告销售额增长
item.description:
China's largest e-commerce player Alibaba Group (9988.HK) said it recorded year-on-year growth over this year's Singles Day sales period that ended at midnight on Saturday, while rival JD.com (9618.HK) reported sales volumes at a record high.翻译:中国最大的电子商务公司阿里巴巴集团（9988.HK）表示，在周六午夜结束的今年“双十一”销售期间，其销售额同比增长，而竞争对手京东（9618.HK）的销售额为创历史新高。

Data provider Syntun, meanwhile, estimated cumulative gross merchandising volume (GMV) sales across major e-commerce platforms rose 2.08% to 1.14 trillion yuan ($156.40 billion) compared with growth of 2.9% last year.翻译:与此同时，数据提供商 Syntun 估计主要电子商务平台的累计商品交易总额 (GMV) 增长 2.08%，达到 1.14 万亿元人民币（1,564 亿美元），而去年增长 2.9%。

Originally a 24-hour online shopping event held on Nov. 11 each year in China, the Singles Day festival - a nod to the digits in the date - has expanded into weeks of promotions across the country's major e-commerce platforms and in bricks-and-mortar stores.翻译:原本是每年 11 月 11 日在中国举办的 24 小时在线购物活动，双十一（对日期中的数字的致敬）已扩展到全国主要电子商务平台和实体店的为期数周的促销活动。实体商店。

Expectations for sales growth for the festival, which is viewed as a gauge of consumer confidence, were subdued this year as the economy struggles to recover.翻译:由于经济难以复苏，今年节日销售增长的预期被视为衡量消费者信心的指标。

Last year, when China was emerging from COVID-19 curbs, Alibaba, the country's largest e-commerce player by market share, did not disclose the yuan value of its sales for the festival for the first time.翻译:去年，当中国刚刚摆脱 COVID-19 的限制时，中国市场份额最大的电子商务公司阿里巴巴首次没有披露其节日销售额的人民币价值。

Again this year, it said only that sales were positive, without giving details, for its e-commerce platforms Tmall and Taobao.翻译:今年，该公司再次仅表示其电子商务平台天猫和淘宝的销售情况良好，但没有透露细节。

Alibaba, put pressure on merchants to price aggressively this Singles Day, and at the start of the festival in late October, said it would offer 80 million products at their deepest discount of the year.翻译:阿里巴巴向商家施压，要求他们在双十一期间大幅定价，并在 10 月底双十一开始时表示，将以今年最大的折扣出售 8000 万件产品。

Analysts saw this as an attempt to fight back against rivals such as Douyin and PDD Holdings' (PDD.O) Pinduoduo that have changed the landscape of Chinese e-commerce in recent years by selling lower-cost and discounted items year-round.翻译:分析师认为，此举是为了反击抖音和拼多多旗下拼多多等竞争对手，这些竞争对手近年来通过全年销售低成本和折扣商品，改变了中国电子商务的格局。

Discounts of 40%-50% were much more common than in previous years as a result.翻译:因此，40%-50% 的折扣比前几年更为常见。

A Bain and Company report released last week found that 77% of the 3,000 consumers it surveyed had planned to spend less or the same amount on Singles Day compared with last year.翻译:贝恩公司上周发布的一份报告发现，在其调查的 3,000 名消费者中，有 77% 的人计划在双十一期间的支出与去年相比减少或相同。

Bain said shoppers intended to spend on necessities such as tissues, handwash, instant noodles and pet food, while trading down and buying less in discretionary or big-ticket categories such as home appliances and furniture.翻译:贝恩表示，购物者打算花在纸巾、洗手​​液、方便面和宠物食品等必需品上，同时减少购买家用电器和家具等非必需品或大件商品。

Several consultancies predicted Singles Day GMV growth across platforms could return to double-digit growth for the first time since the pandemic, but the final sales picture will take time to emerge.翻译:多家咨询公司预测，双十一各平台的 GMV 增长可能会自疫情以来首次恢复两位数增长，但最终的销售情况还需要一段时间才能显现。

The GMV figures take into account the value of all orders placed, and do not capture the amount that will be returned later.翻译:GMV 数字考虑了所有下订单的价值，并且不包含稍后将退回的金额。

Analysts and industry executives expect return rates to be high this year as consumers buy more in order to obtain larger discounts on checkout, only to return the items they do not need.翻译:分析师和行业高管预计，今年的退货率将会很高，因为消费者为了在结账时获得更大折扣而购买更多商品，结果却退回了不需要的商品。

Items related to health and wellness and outdoor lifestyles were expected to outperform, with global brands such as Nike (NKE.N) and Lululemon (LULU.O) expected to sell well.翻译:与健康和保健以及户外生活方式相关的商品预计将表现出色，耐克(NKE.N)和 Lululemon (LULU.O)等全球品牌预计将畅销。

Alibaba reported that sales of road bikes jumped by 300% during the first hour of sales.翻译:阿里巴巴报告称，公路自行车的销量在销售的第一个小时内猛增了 300%。

Colour cosmetics, traditionally a strong performer throughout the Singles Day sales period, were expected to struggle this year as make-up demand remains low almost a year after China lifted strict COVID-19 restrictions. ($1 = 7.2891 Chinese yuan renminbi)翻译:彩妆传统上在双十一销售期间表现强劲，预计今年将陷入困境，因为在中国取消严格的 COVID-19 限制近一年后，化妆品需求仍然较低。 （1 美元 = 7.2891 人民币）
